title.narrative: OPT 3.7.3: POLICY ADVOCACY

description.narrative: 3.7.3 Political commitment, accountability and national capacity to legislate, plan and fund inclusive social policies are strengthened, which contributes to Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3.7 By 2017, public policies, social protection systems, legal framework, and budget allocations in favour of children, adolescents and vulnerable women are strengthened at national and subnational levels, and are based on evidence and backed by disaggregated data.

participating-org.narrative: UNIDAD DE ANALISIS DE POLITICAS SOC Y ECONOMICAS

sector.narrative: National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)

description.narrative: Other General Services support to civil society

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.7.3 Political commitment, accountability and national capacity to legislate, plan and fund inclusive social policies arestrengthened

description.narrative: Important results were achieved this year on PF4C and on the strengthening of the Parliamentarian Network for Children. Information from the national and the regional SitAns were also used for the integrated planning system of the State, demonstrating an increased political commitment to strengthen social policies. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2017

title.narrative: The design and implementation of public policies in favour of children and adolescents at the national and subnational levels are based on the new Child and Adolescent Bill and Family Code

baseline.value: Assembly members in Cochabamba, Beni and Pando legislate within the framework of the previous Child and Adolescent Code

target.value: 2017:Assembly members and Departmental Brigades in Beni, Cochabamba and Pando strengthened their capacity to legislate within the framework of the new Child and Adolescent Code and enforce Departmental in

actual.value: 2015:In Beni and Pando, departmental assembly members were trained on the most relevant issues of the new Children and Adolescents Code

title.narrative: Within the framework of the new Child and Adolescent Code, the Departments design and implement Departmental Plans favouring children and adolescents

baseline.value: Cochabamba, Beni and Pando do not have Departmental Plans in place for children and adolescents. Policies in favour of children and adolescents. Policies in favour of children and adolescents.

target.value: 2017:Potosi Q4 and Chuquisaca Q4. The Departments of Beni, Cochabamba and Pando (Q4 2017) have child and adolescent plans in place. Cochabamba and Pando Q4 2016. Beni Q4 2017

actual.value: 2015:Chuquisaca and Potosi Departmental Plans for child and adolescent in initial stage o design.

title.narrative: The Knowledge Station for Children's Rights in Bolivia generates evidence, analysis and research on child and adolescent rights

baseline.value: First Report on Childhood from the Knowledge Station 2012

target.value: 2017:At least three reports are generated on child and adolescent rights

actual.value: 2015:Three conferences were held: (i) an analysis of juvenile justice in Latin America, (ii) a socio-demography of the family and ages of life in the Andean countries: guidelines, contributions and sharing platforms, (iii) research on children and education in Peru: opening new fields and perspectives

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of mechanisms to increase inclusion of excluded children into social protection

target.value: 2017:At least two plans at municipal level focused on most marginalized and excluded children designed

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of domestic legislation and administrative guidance in accordance with the Concluding Observations of Committee on the Rights of the Child

actual.value: 2017:Ley departamental y reglamento sobre politicas publicas para NNA

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of domestic legislation and administrative guidance in accordance with the Concluding Observations of Committee on the Rights of the Child
The design and implementation of public policies in favour of children and adolescents at the national and subnational levels are based on the new Child and Adolescent Bill and Family Code

target.value: 2017:The Parliamentary Network is trained and prepared in the new codes.

actual.value: 2015:During 2015 parliamentary members have been informed and trained on the new Children and Adolescents Code.

title.narrative: The design and implementation of public policies in favour of children and adolescents at the national and subnational levels are based on the new Child and Adolescent Bill and Family Code

target.value: 2017:Strategic guidelines based on CDN and CEDAW are submitted to prepare major laws and regulations at the national level

actual.value: 2015:Promulgation of a Departmental Law in Chuquisaca for children and adolescents

title.narrative: A budget is published annually that is dedicated to infancy, childhood and adolescence, and that includes sectorally and geographically disaggregated information.

baseline.value: Social expenditure dedicated to children and adolescents between 2000-2012 (UDAPE-UNICEF)

target.value: 2017:Annual efficiency and impact of the dedicated budget, including sectorally and geographically disaggregated information

actual.value: 2015:A methodology for analyzing the budget for children was developed and is available on the Ministry of Economy

title.narrative: A national action plan to build awareness on the care and protection of Mother Earth, with inputs collected at youth gatherings in the nine Departments of the country

baseline.value: Survey La voz de la Ni?ez

target.value: 2017:National action plan implemented for the sensitization of the care of the Mother Earth.

actual.value: 2015:Document: Guidelines of the Environmental Education Strategy finalized and submitted to the Ministry of Environment and Water
